blog.name: fictional-downey
blog.title: Fictional Downey
blog.description: Hi! Welcome to my Robert Downey Jr. fanfiction blog! I'm a HUGE fan of RDJ (and not just since he took on the role of Iron Man I've loved him for YEARS). Yes, I know there is TONS of fanfiction out there and mine isn't anything special, but I'm posting anyway ;-). I'll post chapter by chapter, BUT also have all the finished chapters posted under the "The Stories" link below. Feedback is appreciated - even POLITE criticism. Have fun (and yes, there are ADULT chapters)!

summary: Celebra Robert Downey Jr. cumpleaños a un estilo muy particular
title: Celebra Robert Downey Jr. cumpleaños a un estilo muy particular
body:
Celebra Robert Downey Jr. cumpleaños a un estilo muy particular

La imagen deja ver a los Vengadores en una situación muy similar a la famosa obra ‘La última cena

ESTADOS UNIDOS.- Robert Downey Jr festeja su cumpleaños número 54 de una manera muy particular.

El actor recibió un curioso regalo por parte de un fanático de Marvel y le gustó tanto que lo publicó en su cuenta de Instagram.

La imagen deja ver a los Vengadores en una situación muy similar a la famosa…

blog.name: quietbegalaxy
blog.title: Gala/Galaxy
blog.description: Hello! I love to watch anime, read books and manga, am obsessed with Marvel, and love to draw anime styled characters. Mostly fanart, with some OCs thrown in. Nice to meet you all!

summary: ~ Tony Stark, Marvel I tried something new! I watched a SAI tutorial on Lighting and Glow effect, and of course I had to test...
caption:
~ Tony Stark, Marvel

I tried something new! I watched a SAI tutorial on Lighting and Glow effect, and of course I had to test them out on Tony! I love the way it turned out, and I had way more fun doing this than any other drawing I’ve done (except for that jellyfish I did years back).

Oh! And I also downloaded some SAI brushes and I urge anyone using SAI to switch from the default brushes to others! The difference this new brush had on my lineart compared to the default pencil was amazing! It perfectly captured how I wanted my lines to flow and the pen pressure actually worked!

Sorry for the long post, I’m just so happy! For once, I’m happy with the lineart and the result! Oh, and another tip, make the canvas size bigger. It’ll help with zooming in and adding in those small details. I would recommend something around 2000x4000 pixel, and experiment around with what size you would prefer. I’m not an expert, just someone who took some tips and would gladly share them!

~ Galaxy

summary: My 4th Marvel Anniversary!
title: My 4th Marvel Anniversary!
body:
It’s officially April the 6th, which means it is officially my 4th Marvel Anniversary! I started knowing about Marvel because one of my cousins (the oldest one among them, but still 6 years younger than me) was obsessed with Iron Man, and I remember him watching one of Tony’s movies in my bedroom. I think I knew about the overall existence of Marvel and the Avengers before, but really, that was it. The following easter we were spending the holidays together in the countryside, and on Easter Monday the TV was transmitting “Captain America: The First Avenger”. I was intrigued, so I decided to watch it with him, just to know a little bit about Marvel - and because the historically set plot seemed quite interesting. Honestly, sometimes I wonder what would have happened instead if I had decided to spend my evening studying or whatever. Maybe I’m just being dramatic, but who knows.

Anyways, I didn’t expect to like the movie as much as I did, at all. I was completely astonished: I had loved every second of it. Coming home from the holidays I watched the sequel, “Captain America: The Winter Soldier”, which came to be my favorite Marvel movie ever, and then I watched the Avengers movie and the Thor films. My first time at the cinema for Marvel happened for “Avengers: Age of Ultron”, which has another special place in my heart. It took me a bit of time to watch the Iron Man movies and the Guardians’, but I went to the cinema for almost every release after AoU. I started re-watching them (mainly the captain america ones), buying merch (special mention to my cap’s shield pillow), and slowly becoming more and more interested in the stories the MCU tells.

I cannot really comprehend how some people can dismiss the Marvel movies as children’s movies, a bunch even refusing to watch them, or how others can simply watch one movie here and there without following the storyline, not finding anything special or worthy of time and thought. It is indeed true that the MCU brings to the big screen some kids’ favorites, but it is also very clear, from the first Iron Man, that they are so much more. They propose heroes to anyone who’s willing to sit down and listen, they show exemplary complicated lives every adult can draw inspiration and strength from. They may be doing things normal people can’t do - we can’t lift Thor’s hammer, we can’t inject ourselves with the super soldier serum, we can’t easily gain Nat’s or Clint’s super-spies abilities, and we definitely can’t build Iron Man’s suit - but what we can do is using them to define ourselves and our goals. We can aspire to be “not a perfect soldier, but a good man” and fight the struggle and corruption of our lives like Cap, who never stays indifferent in the face of injustice and knows that obedience is not patriotism. He stands small compared to Thanos: all he can do is raise his bare hands and scream at the top of his lungs as he tries to hold the mad titan back - but he still does it, he still tries. As you have probably noticed, I’m particularly attached to Steve (and yes, really scared for him right now), but the same discourse goes for each and every single one of the characters. We can always find one who helps us understand who we are and how we want to be. They can help us become something more, as the iconic Avengers line says. Heroes teach us courage, strength, optimism, constance, will, and, sometimes, wisdom. They help us carry on despite our troubles. Ultimately, I think that the famous quote, «There was an idea… to bring together a group of remarkable people, to see if they could become something more. To fight the battles that we never could» is referred to the Avengers but aimed at us. Get up, fight for those who can’t, and work to become something more in the light of the values that heroes can teach you. Be glad that Marvel heroes have a huge appeal on children, because they will grow up with such values as well. Heroes can pick us up when we are beaten, weak and afraid. They offer us a stimulus to be able to cope, a light in the darkness (and a fire under our asses). Without heroes, we would be alone in our strife - and the MCU proposes some amazing ones to look up to.

So, happy anniversary to me!

- Francesca (fearing for endgame)

you can find me twitter: @njghtlock

A thank you to my cinema & society professor and his lessons on heroes, I borrowed a couple of his thoughts to try to convey what I feel - he’s way better at explaining it.

blog.name: science-lings
blog.title: Tony Stark Appreciator
blog.description: I go by Gay or Grump| 18 | She/They | Team Iron Man | Lesbian  | AO3 writer Sciencelings | Low-Key Artist | INFP | Tony Stark, Peter Parker, Carol Danvers, Billy Kaplan, Bobby Drake, and Harley Keener Stan | Irondad | X-Men | Anti-Starker because I’m a fucking normal person |

summary: Tony "I'm Iron Man" Stark
question: Tony "I'm Iron Man" Stark
answer:
general opinion: fall in a hole and die | don’t like them | eh | they’re fine I guess | like them! | love them | actual love of my life 

hotness level: get away from me | meh | neutral | theoretically hot but not my type | pretty hot | gorgeous! | 10/10 would bang (I'm pretty gay so…)

hogwarts house: gryffindor | slytherin | ravenclaw | hufflepuff

best quality: his brain! He smart! (also his heart and his butt)  

worst quality: Poor boy doesn’t know how feelings work and his friends are assholes

ship them with: Pepper! (but also Peter Quill, T’Challa, Rhodey, sometimes Natasha)

brotp them with: Peter! I love irondad! (obviously, but also all of the above. and May. co-parent buds) 

needs to stay away from: Steve Rogers! No hate but they are not good for each other. 

misc. thoughts: I love him so much. I love how he’s bi-coded, I love how he has openly depicted mental illness and how his superpower is his brain. I love that he keeps on fucking up and he just keeps getting back up and becoming better. No matter how many people betray him, he is still earths greatest defender. 

OG POST

blog.name: marvelousdaydreams
blog.title: Marvel
blog.description:
A blog dedicated solely to Marvel (and sometimes more). I’m a full time college student. Masterlist // MCU as vines playlist

No slander or libel of any kind against any character, but nuanced critiques will be more than allowed :)

summary: Trying to rid the world of weapons, you gave her its best one.
body:
Trying to rid the world of weapons, you gave her its best one.

Obadiah Stane, telling the truth by accident because Tony became Earth’s best defender.
